alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 14 at 11:38PM EDT until March 15 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM CONTINUES TONIGHT... .Low pressure over the Gulf of Maine will continue to produce snow along with strong, gusty winds through tonight. Additional snowfall accumulations will be relatively minor compared with the snow we`ve experienced thus far, with most snow being light to at times moderate in intensity, however snowfall accumulated on trees and power lines combined with wind may still lead to additional power outages. Travel will continue to be hazardous due to areas of blowing snow as well. Snow will continue to diminish in coverage and intensity through Wednesday morning, with light showers persisting over the mountains through the day. Winds on the other hand will remain gusty through Wednesday with gusts to around 30-35 mph. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In Maine, Central Somerset, Northern Franklin, and Northern Oxford Counties. In New Hampshire, Northern Coos and Southern Coos Counties. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Light to moderate snow along with blowing snow will combine to create low visibility and dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford
